{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3322629,"name":"David","username":"David1576","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/f17d59/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-03T17:20:46.903Z","cooked":"

Hello
I am from team 1576 and recently we’ve had a few spark max’s acting very strangely
We turn on the robot and as soon as one of them gets power ot gets turned off.
We turn the robot on again it’s LED’s don’t turn on.
Then we connect to it using rev hardware via usb c and it turns on, showing a brown out sticky fault.
We change the port it’s connected on and it turns on again
Enable, power it, and the cycle repeats.
What should we do?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-03-03T17:20:46.903Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":84,"readers_count":83,"score":61.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":457054,"topic_slug":"weird-spark-max-behaviour","display_username":"David","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64730,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/weird-spark-max-behaviour/457054/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3325541,"name":"Brady Starler","username":"Brady_S42","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brady_s42/{size}/203921_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T13:34:23.567Z","cooked":"

I could be wrong about this because I’m only so familiar with Spark MAXs, but that just seems like maybe something happened that damaged the actual hardware inside the Spark MAX independent of the robot or REV Hardware Client.

What I would recommend is to make sure that the Spark MAX has fully updated software, even if that means using a different one if you can’t update this one. Another thing I’d recommend would be to try recovery mode on it using the REV Hardware Client, and make sure that is also updated.

Checking the breakers in your PDP/PDH is important to see if you’re providing the right power and that the pathway isn’t shorting, sparking, or broken. I’d love it if you keep me posted on the progress for this!

Try replacing it with a different, previously known working and fully updated Spark MAX. If the issue persists, check for power issues. If that doesn’t work, REV Support is helpful and sent our team new ones after we sent our broken ones back.

Good luck!
